creatures.message.bird_carrier.use_critt: You might want to use a critter container instead
creatures.message.critter_keeper.use_bir: A critter container is way too small for a bird
advancements.creatures.discover_doves.de: Find a dove in your adventures
advancements.creatures.falconry_master.d: Tame every bird of prey added by Frikinzi's Fauna
advancements.creatures.falconer.title: Falconer
advancements.creatures.feed_fish.title: Koi Pond
advancements.husbandry.birder.title: Frikinzi's Fauna Birder
advancements.husbandry.birder.descriptio: Begin your study of birds by crafting Frikinzi's Guide
description.lovebird.fischers: These beautiful and energetic birds are native to Tanzania. Due to their love for fruits and seeds, they can damage crops.
description.lovebird.fischersmutation: A lutino variant of the fischer's lovebird popular in captivity. The mutation is sex-linked.
description.lovebird.masked: These lovebirds are native to large plateaus in eastern Tanzania, at 1,100 to 1,800 meters in elevation.
description.lovebird.maskedmutation: A blue mutant of the wild-type masked lovebird that is very popular as a pet.
description.lovebird.peach: Despite their reputation as monogamous, affectionate birds, lovebirds are aggressive and territorial.
description.lovebird.madagascar: One of the few sexually dimorphic lovebird species, these birds are difficult to raise in captivity.
description.lovebird.blackwingedlovebird: It is native to Ethiopia in the Abyssinian highlands. It uses its own feathers for its nest.
description.lovebird.redfaced: It is native to African tropical rainforests. It burrows to make its nests and requires a temperature of 27 C.
description.lovebird.swindern: There has been little success keeping this species because of its dietary requirement for a native fig.
description.lovebird.blackcheeked: It may not look like it, but it is actually more closely related to Lilian's lovebird than the masked lovebird.
description.lovebird.lilians: Loneliness is a health concern for these birds. They are declining in numbers because of poacher poisoning.
description.lovebird.aquamarine: It is an autosomal recessive mutation for the peach-faced lovebird.
description.lovebird.bluepeachfaced: It is an autosomal recessive mutation for the peach-faced lovebird.
description.creatures.barnowl: Barn owls have excellent night vision to help hunt prey. They swallow their prey full - including skin and bones.
description.creatures.barracuda: Barracudas have teeth that point backwards to prevent smaller fish from escaping.
description.creatures.painted: The male's bright plumage only comes in his second year of life. For its beauty, it has been nicknamed "nonpareil".
description.creatures.indigo: It is brown during the winter. The male's brightly colored plumage serves to attract a mate.
description.creatures.rosebellied: It lives in a narrow strip of the Isthmus of Tehuantepec. It is in decline because of habitat destruction.
description.creatures.orangebellied: It is native to Mexico. It lives in tropical dry forests and builds cup-shaped nests.
description.creatures.varied: The females are brown while the male is a stunning purple and red. It lives in thorny bushes in deserts.
description.creatures.longtailedtit: It is also known as Shima Enaga. These fluffy snow fairies have flown into the hearts of the Japanese.
description.creatures.longtailedtite: It has considerable global diversity, with 17 races recognized. Only 17% of nests succeed due to high predation.
description.creatures.blackthroat: It is a very social bird found throughout Asia. They will often join mixed-species flocks.
description.creatures.abushtit: Unlike most other bird species, the male is the main caretaker of the nest.
description.creatures.capercaillie: It's the world's largest grouse. It became extinct in the UK in the 18th century, but has since made a come back.
description.creatures.atlanticpuffin: They are affectionately known as the clowns of the sea. They are excellent swimmers and divers.
description.creatures.hornedpuffin: Their dark back blends in with the dark water, while the white belly helps them hide from predators swimming below.
description.creatures.tuftedpuffin: They can catch and carry more than 20 fish at once, and live up to 20 years.
description.creatures.atlanticpuffinleuc: There are only few leucism reports in puffins. One was sighted in Handa in 2021.
description.creatures.atlanticpuffinpieb: They are also called partially albino. It is an extremely rare sighting. Congratulations!
description.creatures.stellersseaeagle: They are endemic to northeast Asia, and one of the largest raptors overall.
description.creatures.baldeagle: Bald eagles can live for up to 30 years in the wild, and mate for life.
description.creatures.whitetailedeagle: They are considered as the fourth largest eagle in the world. In the UK, it went extinct in the early 20th century.
description.creatures.africanfisheagle: It has barbs on its feet to help hold onto fish, its main prey. It is the national bird of Zambia, Zimbabwe and South Sudan.
description.creatures.whitebelliedeagle: It mainly feeds on fish, but is an opportunistic feeder that can eat carrion and other prey.
description.creatures.piedavocet: They nest on open grounds, sometimes with other shore birds. They scythe their bills from side to side to forage.
description.creatures.andeanavocet: It sweeps its bill from side to side to catch crustaceans. It is a non-migratory species.
description.creatures.redneckedavocet: Its call has been described as yapping, and when it flies, it is said to sound like a dog barking.
description.creatures.americanavocet: In the spring, it migrates in flocks of 30-500 individuals to their breeding grounds. They prefer habitats with fine sediment.
description.creatures.yelloweyedpenguin: It is endemic to New Zealand. The Otago Peninsula is a popular tourist destination for observing these penguins.
description.creatures.goldeneagle: Golden eagles are the largest birds of prey in North America. They can swoop at prey at 150 miles per hour.
description.creatures.arapaima: They do not migrate. Scientists suspect that there are many undiscovered species in the Amazon Basin.
description.creatures.arowana: The shape of their mouth allows them to get oxygen at the surface. As pets, they are difficult because of their pickiness.
description.creatures.dottyback: Dottyback fish are notoriously aggressively territorial towards other fish when kept in an aquarium.
description.creatures.goldfish: Perhaps one of the most abused aquarium fish in the hobby. Goldfish can grow very large and need a minimum of 40 gallons.
description.creatures.frigate: Frigate birds have the largest wingspan-to-weight ratio of any bird. They have been found to sleep on the fly.
description.creatures.emperorpenguin: Emperor penguin colonies have been discovered and counted from space. Colonies are found by looking at their gauno stains on ice.
description.creatures.kingpenguin: King penguins are serial monogamists, which means that they are faithful to their partner for the breeding season only.
description.creatures.mandarinduck: Mandarin ducks are used as a symbol for Chinese weddings because of their monogamy. They represent fidelity and happiness.
description.creatures.mantisshrimp: A mantis shrimp's punch is as fast as a bullet and can reach the temperature of the sun! Humans have built robots to mimick their punch.
description.creatures.osprey: The osprey species is at least 11 million years old. They feed almost exclusively on live fish.
description.creatures.parrotfish: The beak of a parrotfish enables it to chomp on coral. They are an essential part of the reef ecosystem that help with algae control.
description.creatures.shrimp: Cherry shrimp are popular aquarium pets with an assortment of colors. If different colors are bred, they usually produce a wild-type shrimp.
description.creatures.stingray: Stingrays detect their prey via electrical signals. Although it may not look like it, they are closely related to sharks.
description.creatures.littlepenguin: Little blue penguins have dense melanosomes in their feathers, contributing to both their blue color and their speed in the water.
description.creatures.woodduck: Their name comes from the fact that they perch and nest on trees. Their sharp claws enable them to grip branches.
description.creatures.whistlingduck: Whistling ducks are social birds. They nest in trees, hence are also named tree ducks.
description.creatures.elephantnosefish: Elephant-nose fish have the largest brain to body oxygen use ratio of any vertebrate (0.6). They use electrolocation to find prey.
description.creatures.vampirecrab: Despite their name, they do not feed on blood. Instead, they are opportunistic feeders that eat terrestrial insects and vegetation.
description.creatures.fiddlercrab: Fiddler crabs have a circadian rhythm that mimics the ebb and flow of the tides. They play important roles in the ecosystem by shaping the sediment.
description.creatures.firegoby: These monogamous fish face the current, waiting for their invertebrate prey. They are known to be peaceful and sociable in aquariums.
description.creatures.kakapo: Kakapo are nocturnal and the only flightless parrot. They are possibly one of the longest-lived birds, living up to 100 years.
description.creatures.dove.jambu: The green of jambu fruit doves acts as camouflage. The female is believed by the Temoq people to be a form of their creator ancestor.
description.creatures.dove.release: Many doves released in ceremonies die due to being vulnerable to predators. As such, there is a decreased demand for these services.
description.creatures.dove.rose: They feed on vines, seeds, and palms. Despite their small size, they can swallow fruits up to 1 inch in diameter.
description.creatures.dove.rock: Rock doves were used in war as messengers throughout history, saving many lives. They can return home even blindfolded, using magnetic fields as cues.
description.creatures.dove.flame: The orange fruit dove is endemic to Fiji. It is not a social bird, often only living alone or in pairs.
description.creatures.dove.goldenheart: It is native to New Guinea. It is an omnivore that eats insects and fallen fruit off of the ground.
description.creatures.dove.mbleeding: They are threatened by habitat loss and capture for the pet trade. Among all bleeding-hearts, it has the darkest-colored 'heart' of them all.
description.creatures.dove.orangebellied: The orange-bellied fruit dove relies on figs for its diet. Their nests have been rarely found because they nest very high up.
description.creatures.dove.victoria: It's the largest species of pigeon in the world. Like other pigeons, they produce 'milk' in the crop to feed their young.
description.creatures.dove.mourning: They are known to build nests in questionable locations, such as in your garage. Their iconic cooing is almost always coming from a male looking for a mate.
description.creatures.dove.europeanturtl: These doves are migratory, heading off to Africa during the winter. Populations are declining due to decreased food availability.
description.creatures.dove.snow: They live on rocky hills throughout central to east Asia. They nest in crevices in the face of cliffs.
description.creatures.dove.nicobar: It is the closest living relative of the extinct dodo bird. They currently hunted for food and captured as a pet.
description.creatures.dove.pacificemeral: They are very tame and approachable. As such, they are easy targets for predators such as cats and cassowaries.
description.creatures.dove.crested: When taking flight, they make a distinct whistling sound (listen to it in-game!). This serves as an alarm call to other birds and to distract the predator.
description.creatures.dove.spinifex: They are restricted to areas with permanent water, as they do not travel. They eat plants that adapt to arid conditions, including one called spinifex.
description.creatures.dove.pink: In 1991, only 10 individuals remained. As of 2011, the population is around 500, and it has been downgraded from being critically endangered to vulnerable.
description.creatures.shoebill: Despite looking like a stork, it is actually more related to herons and pelicans. It is normally silent, but perform bill-clattering sounds at the nest.
description.creatures.skua: Skuas are fierce predators that primarily feed on penguin chicks and eggs, and engage in kleptoparasitism, meaning that they steal from other birds.
description.creatures.raven: Ravens are among the largest passerine species. One word to refer to a flock of them is 'unkindness'. They are highly intelligent and are known to use tools.
description.creatures.chickadee: Chickadees are tough birds that do not migrate. They hide food for later and can remember many special hiding places.
description.creatures.clownfish: Clownfish are all born as males. In an anemone, the larger clownfish is the female. If the female dies, the remaining male will turn female.
description.creatures.pelican: A pelican can hold up to 3 gallons of water in its pouch, 2-3 times more than what its stomach can hold. It can spot fish from 65 feet in the air.
description.creatures.piranha: Despite their reputation, piranhas are timid and not very dangerous to people. In fact, many piranha species are actually herbivores.
description.creatures.monal: Monals live in high altitudes up to 4,000 feet. They move to lower altitudes during the winter. Unfortunately, monals are poached for their crest.
description.creatures.lungfish: Lungfish are living fossils that have a unique ability to live outside of water for up to months when encased in mud. This allows them to survive dry periods.
description.creatures.ranchu: Ranchu goldfish were bred from the lionhead goldfish. The lack of a dorsal fin makes them poor swimmers, and they are susceptible to dropsy due to inbreeding.
description.creatures.pygmyfalcon: Pygmy falcons are the smallest falcon in the African continent. They use white-headed buffalo weaver nests and do not build their own.
description.creatures.lapwing: They are known for their slow, irregular beats while flying, hence the name. A group of lapwings was known as a 'deceit'.
description.creatures.ediblecrab: Edible crab are subject to the largest fishery in Ireland and Britain. Females carry up to 3,000,000 fertilised eggs.
description.creatures.rockcrab: Rock crab are nicknamed 'peekytoe crab', meaning that the legs are curve inwards. They eat lobster bait, making them a nuisance to lobster fishers.
description.creatures.dungenesscrab: Dungeness crab can live up to 13 years in the wild. Regulations only allow fisheries to catch hard-shelled male crabs.
description.creatures.bluecrab: Blue crab is the Maryland state crustacean. Unlike other crabs, they do better in climate change due to warming improving their breeding.
description.creatures.eagleowl: In 2015, an eagle owl in the Netherlands attacked around 50 people before being caught by a falconer.
description.creatures.billfish: Billfish are highly migratory and use their bills to impale prey. They have unintentionally pierced boats and people.
description.creatures.indopacificsailfis: The Indo-Pacific sailfish is the fastest fish in the world, reaching speeds up to 68 miles/hour.
description.creatures.humboldtpenguin: Humboldt penguins are called pajaro-nio in Chile, meaning 'baby bird', due to their waddling gait resembling an infant crawling.
description.creatures.africanpenguin: African penguins are now the rarest penguin, classified as Critically Endangered. They have the nickname 'jackass' because of their loud noises.
description.creatures.magellanicpenguin: It is the most numerous of the banded penguins. They can live for 25 years in the wild, and up to 40 in captivity.
description.creatures.galapagospenguin: It is the only penguin found near the equator, endemic to the Galapagos Islands. They are endangered due to climate change and plastic pollution.
description.creatures.chinstrap: It is also called 'stonecracker penguin' because of its very loud call. they are considered the most aggressive penguin species.
description.creatures.gentoo: Chinstrap and gentoo penguins diverged 14 millions of years ago. They are the fastest swimmers of all penguins, reaching speeds up to 36 km/h.
description.creatures.adelie: They are known for their bold personality, and will challenge animals much larger than them such as petrels.
description.creatures.goldenpheasant: They live in the forest-covered mountains of China. It is a clumsy flier, and would rather run away from predators instead of flying.
description.creatures.ladyamherst: They are closely related to the golden pheasant. The females of both species look very similar, and the two species can be crossbred.
description.creatures.silverpheasant: Silver pheasants are polygynous which means a male will mate with multiple females during the breeding season.
description.creatures.squid: Squids are the fastest invertebrates of the world, and can change color to camouflage itself, attract mates, or repel rivals.
description.creatures.spoonbill: Spoonbills sweep their opened spoon-shaped bill from side to side, snapping its bill shut whenever prey touches it.
description.creatures.kingfisher: Kingfishers were used as inspiration for the Shinkansen bullet trains design. Trains shaped like a kingfisher beak are a lot faster.
description.creatures.lorikeet: Lorikeets have specialized brush-tipped tongues for feeding on flower and soft fruit nectar.
description.creatures.fairywren: Fairywrens are socially monogamous but sexually promiscuous, meaning they form pairs but can mate with others.
description.creatures.flameangel: Flame angelfish can live for 5-7 years or more. They have been successfully bred in captivity in Thailand.
description.creatures.canada: Canada geese practice assortative mating, meaning they will choose mates who are similar in size.
description.creatures.barnacle: Because barnacle geese were never seen in the summer, Medieval people believed that they were developing in the water as barnacles.
description.creatures.graylag: The graylag goose is the ancestor of most breeds of domestic geese. They were domesticated at least as early as 1360 BCE.
description.creatures.snow: Female snow geese are philopatric, meaning that they will return to their birth place to breed.
description.creatures.orinoco: Orinoco goose can be brood parasites, laying eggs in another female's nest. Parasitized nests have a higher percentage of hatched eggs per clutch.
description.creatures.barheaded: Bar-headed geese reach extreme heights as they migrate across the Himalayas. They are one of the highest-flying birds in the world.
description.creatures.threespot: Three spot gourami are named for having 2 spots in addition to the eye counting as the third spot.
description.creatures.roundtailed: Round-tailed paradise fish are native to East Asia and are extremely hardy and adaptable to cold weather.
description.creatures.goldgourami: It is a yellow morph of the three spot gourami.
description.creatures.dwarf: Dwarf gouramis inhabit slow-moving waters with dense vegetation. They are very docile and will not fight back even when attacked.
description.creatures.pearl: At breeding time, the orange on the male's throat becomes brighter. They can breathe air from the atmosphere using their labyrinth organ.
description.creatures.okinawarail: Okinawa rail are declared as a National Monument in Japan, endemic to Okinawa Island. It is a poor flier but it can run rapidly.
description.creatures.plumbeousrail: It makes rudimentary nests near water using dry grass. It is native to South America.
description.creatures.spottedrail: It forages in shallow water for earthworms and other invertebrates. They are threatened by the invasive mongoose.
description.creatures.barredrail: It is a shy species and difficult to spot in the wild. It is known for eating other bird eggs.
description.creatures.guamrail: Invasive brown treesnakes have decimated the Guam rail's population. Thanks to a breeding program, they have been reintroduced to the wild.
description.creatures.fiordland: The female lays a smaller egg first, then a larger egg. The larger egg has a higher chance of survival.
description.creatures.snarescrested: They live in dense colonies on the coast or in the forest near streams. The first egg receives the less favorable anterior incubation spot.
description.creatures.erectcrested: It's endemic to New Zealand. The first egg is smaller than the second egg and receives less accommodation and priority from the mother.
description.creatures.southernrockhopper: The southern rockhopper has complex foraging behaviors, influenced by sea ice abundance, season, and breeding stage.
description.creatures.easternrockhopper: It uses a unique call for parent-chick recognition. They are threatened by climate change due to decreased prey availability.
description.creatures.northernrockhopper: An oil spill on Nightingale Island threatened the northern rockhopper population there. They were transported to Tristan da Cunha for cleaning.
description.creatures.macaroni: Macaroni penguins are highly social and live in very large and dense breeding colonies. They use a variety of vocal cues to communicate with others.
description.creatures.royalpenguin: Royal penguins commonly abandon their first egg, which has half the chance of survival as the second egg, the reasons being unknown.
description.creatures.gull: Gulls migrate to warmer habitats during the winter. They are long-lived, with some species being recorded to live up to 49 years.
description.creatures.leafydragon: Leafy dragons have a lifespan of 2 years in captivity. They live in rocky reefs in southern Australia.
description.creatures.weedydragon: The fronds that resemble kelp help it camouflage. It also has some short spines for protection.
description.creatures.rubydragon: Ruby seadragons went undiscovered for a long time, due to living in the deep waters.
description.creatures.tigerbarb: These fish have a reputation for being aggressive in the aquarium. They lose their stripes in lower temperatures.
description.creatures.rubybarb: Ruby barbs are threatened by the aquarium trade. They prefer to eat filamentous algae and detritus.
description.creatures.trumpetfish: Trumpetfish are mostly motionless and stalk prey by slowly inching towards them, then suddenly darting and snapping at them.
description.creatures.trout: Trout are an important food fish for humans due to being classified as an oily fish. They are also important prey for wildlife such as bears and raptors.
description.creatures.duck: Ducks should not be fed bread, as it is damaging for their health.
description.creatures.tarantula: Most species only bite as a last resort. New World species have mild venom and have urticating hairs, while Old World species have more potent venom.
